bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, July 15, 1901

div1.p: Carter proposes that they take a holiday because he is not feeling well.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, July 15, 1901
div1.opener:
Treasury Department,
Office of the Supervising Surgeon-General
Marine-Hospital Service,
Washington, D. C.,
7/15/01
wrong date
Dear Laura
div1.p:
How would you like, just
you & I. (or if we stay long enough
you & I & Henry) to go somewhere in
the up country for a few weeks
& see if both of us cannot get
some of the strength we have
lost?

It is wrong for me to come
home pretending it is to re-
cuperate. I will not gain
strength there in the summer
It suits me less well than
this place.

I am again all broken
up, whether due to my
trip or to the two hot night
nights I have spent I do
not know, but am feeling
mean today.

If you think so please wri
judge if we can go to
the Hubards - or to any
one who takes boarders
hight up in Amherst or
Nelson.

In the mean time I have
written to N. C. (Blowing
Rock)

May be nothing in it of
C1
B29
course, but I think neither
of us is f is fit to go to
work - you to housekeeping
I to hospital management -
from Wm or North River
I will be feeling all
right tomorrow
or next day
Ned is back - is going
into West Va, (fishing) tomorrow
& thence to see little Em
ma.
div1.closer:
H. R. Carter Would take Henry so that I
could teach him, if we stayed
until after school opened.
